text:
Julia Syndrome :sneezing_face:-- _worrying about the performance of one's app before one even starts seeing problems._
Terminal Pre-Julia Syndrome :skull:-- _worrying about the performance of one's app so badly that one never gets around to writing it._

elements.text: worrying about the performance of one's app before one even starts seeing problems.
worrying about the performance of one's app so badly that one never gets around to writing it.

text: I see a lot of people worrying about allocations. I'm wondering though if trying to avoid allocations ultimately might end up eating more time than straightforward code.

elements.text: I see a lot of people worrying about allocations. I'm wondering though if trying to avoid allocations ultimately might end up eating more time than straightforward code.

text: the evolution of “Premature optimization is the root of all evil”

text: I opened an issue recently to the effect: Stop strongly typing everything, trust in Any

text: The next person who writes a compiler over the type system...

text: I've embraced the fact that types in structs are always good, and everywhere else only needed if necessary to speed things up/change dispatch
